And @EnvAgency says "We will continue to be guided by 3 principles in choosing what we do: ‚Ä¢ Put people & wildlife first: our goal is to create a better place for them."  So plant trees, create attenuation ponds, don't quarry right up to medieval Coggeshall.  #sledgehammer

tweets.text: @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @NewsNBC @PublicHealthEng 100%. @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids  you can go out for a few hours and the air has cleared in the area, yet indoors retains it. By the time you've got some airflow through the house the smell is back. It's farcical.

@EnvAgencyMids this is a genuine question, the landfill gas can fill my home for hours, long after it clears outside. Your phone line doesn't ask for duration of exposure and your exterior monitoring won't account for this. @StinkStopthe @NewsNBC @PublicHealthEng #StopTheStink https://t.co/vzNu7LrhlF

200 trees planted @CroxtethHall by the new wetland. Many thanks to @merseyforest for donating them. Lots of nice comments from passers by üòä Reed planting tomorrow #nfm #ACCP @EnvAgencyNW @cpvolgroup https://t.co/ipjMtln6p9

And...on the one hand you @EnvAgency are doing good stuff to connect fish migration routes (this from @EssexWildlife news) yet simultaneously wanting to block the Blackwater with a 300m wide structure https://t.co/O7gtxywGj2
@EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE Your stated aims are to 'protect & improve' water, land and biodiversity.   Please explain how a 400 acre quarry and 300m dam achieves this?   https://t.co/Q3Own6L9WR

Our team have had a busy few days working on #PrimroseNatureReserve, finally craning our fish pass onto the foundations we‚Äôve been building.

We‚Äôre on the home straight and starting to get really excited!

A big thank you goes to #ERDF & @mhclg for making this possibleüëè https://t.co/caxyoODKSU
